titles.title: To direct the Secretary of Labor to modify regulations to allow the use of performance benchmarks in the case of designated investment alternatives, and for other purposes.
To direct the Secretary of Labor to modify regulations to allow the use of performance benchmarks in the case of designated investment alternatives, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and Labor.

bill.summary: This bill permits administrators of employee health or retirement plans to use a blend of different broad-based stock indices (e.g., the Dow Jones Industrial Average) to meet the performance benchmarking requirements for designated investment alternatives if certain conditions are met.
